titlestmt.titleproper: Elizabeth Danto Collection on the Sarah Lawrence College Strike and Teach-In against the United States' Invasion of Cambodia TAM.229

did.unittitle: Elizabeth Danto Collection on the Sarah Lawrence College Strike and Teach-In against the United States' Invasion of Cambodia

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: In 1970 Elizabeth Danto was a student at Sarah Lawrence college. She participated in the Sarah Lawrence College strike and teach-in, one of thousands of such events at colleges and universities, occasioned by the U.S. invasion of Cambodia.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The four folders that comprise this collection are arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains (non-official) student newsletters, principally Emanon, which provide a near-daily account of the events, a detailed list of teach-in programs and other student-created documents, and research materials on the invasion of Cambodia and the Vietnam war, principally Agency French Press dispatches.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Elizabeth Danto sent a gift of Sarah Lawrence College strike materials in 2000. The accession number associated with this gift is 2000.021.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by Elizabeth Danto are held by Elizabeth Danto. Permission to publish or reproduce materials to which s/he holds copyright must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Tamiment Library for assistance with contacting Elizabeth Danto.
